name: Conclave
task: jQuery plugins, responsive Bootsrap jade templates
description: This is a social network project for American schools and teachers.
Jade templates + SASS and LESS under NodeJS Express app.
The team consisted of me and NodeJS developer Alex.
We used oDesk and e-mail communication with Skype.

aboutProject: * [NodeJS with many modules such as Compass](http://nodejs.org)
aboutTeam: On this work I contacted with my main manager from **San Diego Calif.** The team consisted of me and NodeJS developer Alex. We worked in series: I received a design in **PSD format**, after I [programmed html/css with Webstorm tool](http://www.jetbrains.com/webstorm) and **LESS + SASS** under Compass compiler. We used [oDesk](https://www.odesk.com/o/profiles/users/_~01ffe04a2db9f8b16a) and e-mail communication with Skype.
myRole: This e-social network site based on NodeJS and Jade template engine also used SASS as main CSS preprocessor and I used my knowledge of LESS preprocessor also with Twitter Bootstrap as grid based CSS framework. When I worked with project's repo I used [GIT version control system](http://git-scm.com/about) and dedicated server on Linux. I programmed this project under my Mac with SSH port-forwarding techniques. I worked near 5 weeks with this project and developed Jade pages with many SASS code.
* Compass for SASS and JavaScript on server-side with jQuery on frontend
* LESS and SASS code with Bootstrap for all elements
result: After 5 weeks I completed project and main goal was **converting inline CSS styles to SASS** under Twitter Bootstrap and completing JavaScript code.
^My American manager's quote:>>
> I would like to keep working with her as much as possible for future projects too.

name: Premium Parts

name: Chipmarket

result: After 2 weeks I completed project and main goal was **converting PSD to HTML and LESS**.

> Well, nice! We liked your work and skills. LESS is clean and beautiful.
>>During this project I increased my skills with Mustache and LESS.

name: Bookreport
description: Cedarwood Bookreport is complex application deployed on Amazon infrastructure
App for working with organization's files, document flow.
I worked as Vue js developer with Angular js knowledge, used experience with Docker, Python, Amazon Lambda and S3
Communicate with client from Upwork through Slack channels.

aboutProject: * [Vuetify UI Material Design Component Framework for Vue](https://vuetifyjs.com/en/)
* [Uppy for modular JavaScript file uploader to Amazon S3](https://uppy.io)
aboutTeam: I worked in cooperation with main System Architect as Vue Developer with Vue stack, Docker, AWS + Python microservices on backend, and main goal was realization Material UI for Vue app with Vuetify & Stylus.
myRole: Port Angular code to [Vue js](https://vuejs.org): vue components + [Vuetify](https://vuetifyjs.com/en/) and [Stylus](http://stylus-lang.com), vue Routing and Navigation, [Vuex storage](https://vuex.vuejs.org/guide) - single source of true, vue Services
Developed functionality such as user authorization, user profile settings, ajax requests, fetch api, file uploading - for example used [Uppy](https://uppy.io), documents search.
Used knowledge of AWS, Node.js, Python, Redis, Docker
* Amazon Lambda: Node.js microservice for uploading documents into S3 buckets
result: I finished project after 4 months. Developed app with UI in material design style for working with organizaton files and document flow.
^My client's quote:>>
Bla bla bla
I expand my experience with Vuex state management for building large app, now I know more about usage of Vuetify, project increased my Stylus skills.
